AxisStyle
INotifyPropertyChanged
public
ChartSharp.​AxisStyle

Defines the rendering style of an axis.

Functions
AxisStyle
public AxisStyle()

Initializes all properties to their default values

Properties
Color
public Color Color { get; set }

The color of the axis.

Detail

The color of the arrows (If DrawArrow is true), the text label, the Markings (If DrawMarkings is true), the numbers (If DrawNumbers and DrawMarkings is true) and the axis itself are affected.

Default Value

Colors.Black

DrawArrow
public bool DrawArrow { get; set }

If true, an arrow is drawn at the end of the axis. Otherwise no arrow is rendered.

Detail

The bounds of the polygon of the arrow are at the end (LineChart.MaxX or LineChart.MaxY) of the specified interval of the chart.  E.g. If the interval of the X-Axis of a chart is [0;1], then the drawing of the arrow would start at position 1.

The "Thickness" of the arrow is the same as the length of the markings (MarkingLength). The length of the arrow is twice that of MarkingLength.

Default Value

true

DrawMarkings
public bool DrawMarkings { get; set }

If true, the axis will draw markings at positions defined by Markings.

Default Value

true

DrawNumbers
public bool DrawNumbers { get; set }

If DrawMarkings and this value are both true, numbers will be displayed besides the Markings of the axis.  The numbers represent the numerical values of the Markings.

Default Value

true

FontSize
public double FontSize { get; set }

Specifies the size of the font for the Label besides or under the axis. E.g. for the X-Axis, it would determine the size of LineChart.XLabel.  An exception can occur if this value is 0 or smaller.

Default Value

16

IsVisible
public bool IsVisible { get; set }

If true, the axis will be rendered. Otherwise it is not visible

Default Value

true

MarkingLength
public double MarkingLength { get; set }

The length of the markings when rendered.

Default Value

4

Markings
public double[] Markings { get; set }

An array, that specifies the Markings on the axis. Markings are only displayed if DrawMarkings is true.

Detail

If DrawMarkings is true and Markings is null, the interval on the axis is divided into equal parts, seperating the axis into intervals. The number of intervals is 10 if unchanged. The standard value can be changed in LineChart.

If some of the numerical values of the Markings is outside the interval specified for this axis in LineChart, the markings are not rendered as expected.

Default Value

null

MarkingThickness
public double MarkingThickness { get; set }

The thickness of the markings when rendered.

Default Value

1

NumberFontSize
public double NumberFontSize { get; set }

Specifies the size of the font for the numbers besides the axis(If DrawNumbers and DrawMarkings is true).  An exception can occur if this value is 0 or smaller.

Default Value

12

Thickness
public double Thickness { get; set }

Specifies the thickness of the axis.

Default Value

0.1
